results.title: A Practical guide to Europe
results.brief_description: A practical guide for people intending to travel to Europe. Provides advice on accommodation, public transport, food and cultural institutions in the major European cities. Hosted by John Guerrasio.

results.title: Human Nature
results.creator_credit: John Bassett and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Planet for the Taking”.
Host, David Suzuki introduces this program with an update on the global environmental crises. Filmed in Botswana, Tanzania, Kenya and the U.S.A, human nature is an exploration of the origins of the human species and the biological inheritance we share with other life forms.

group_siblings.title: The Runaway Brain
group_siblings.creator_credit: John Bassett and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: The Runaway Brain
results.creator_credit: John Bassett and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Planet for the Taking”.
This programme asks the central question, can we begin to see ourselves not as dominant but as integral, as just one part of the complex pattern of matter and life. Host David Suzuki talks to some of the world’s greatest thinkers about whether science and technology can solve the problems they have created.

results.title: Sunshine North Technical School (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Chris Noonan, Timothy Read and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Place Where Books Are Kept”
Examines new techniques and attitudes toward the total library services in a co-educational technical school in Victoria (Sunshine North Technical School) with a large migrant student population.

results.title: Sacred Heart College for boys
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Place Where Books Are Kept”.
Examines new techniques and attitudes towards the total library services in a Catholic boarding school for boys. Emphasises centralised resources, individualised study and production of new teaching aids. Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.

results.title: Woodbridge District School (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Timothy Read, Chris Noonan and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Place Where Books Are Kept”.
This film shows a media-mobile van visiting a school. The crew on the van is shown instructing the staff of the school in a range of audio-visual activities. Some examples of software are shown and various suggestions are given as to their use within the curricula. Suitable for tertiary level and teachers.
